def insertion_sort(arr):
    d = 0
    while d < len(arr):
        z = i
        while z > 0 and arr[z - 1] > arr[z]:
            temp = arr[z]
            arr[z] = arr[z - 1]
            arr[z - 1] = temp
            z -= 1
        d += 1
    return arr

def insertion_sort(arr):
    d = -1
    while d < len(arr) - 1:
        d += 1
        z = i
        while z > 0 and arr[z - 1] > arr[z]:
            temp = arr[z]
            arr[z] = arr[z - 1]
            arr[z - 1] = temp
            z -= 1
    return arr

"There seems to be a mistake in the code snippet provided. The variable `i` is not defined in the context of the code. Assuming that `i` was meant to be `d`, the corrected loop invariant for the given code would be:

"d_value = sorted(arr[0]->arr[d+1])"

This invariant states that after the `d`-th iteration of the outer loop, the subarray from the start of the array to the element at index `d` is sorted. Note that `d` starts at `-1` and is incremented to `0` before the first comparison in the inner loop, so the first element is considered in the sorted subarray from the start."
